remarks.format: ## Remarks 實值類型代表不帶正負號的整數值範圍從 0 到 18446744073709551615。The value type represents unsigned integers with values ranging from 0 to 18,446,744,073,709,551,615. > [!IMPORTANT] > 類型不符合 CLS 標準。The type is not CLS-compliant. 符合 CLS 標準的替代類型是。The CLS-compliant alternative type is . 可以用來取代改為值，範圍從零至。 can be used instead to replace a value that ranges from zero to . 如需 cls 符合性的詳細資訊，請參閱[語言獨立性以及與語言無關的元件](~/docs/standard/language-independence-and-language-independent-components.md)。For more information about CLS compliance, see [Language Independence and Language-Independent Components](~/docs/standard/language-independence-and-language-independent-components.md). 提供方法來比較此類型的執行個體、 執行個體的值轉換為其字串表示，並將數字的字串表示轉換成此類型的執行個體。 provides methods to compare instances of this type, convert the value of an instance to its string representation, and convert the string representation of a number to an instance of this type.

Microsoft C# 編譯器會產生代表做為參數的值指示物件，然後產生比較的值的方法執行個體和參數表示法。The Microsoft C# compiler generates instructions to represent the value of the parameter as an object, then generates a method that compares the values of the instance and the parameter representation. 請參閱您的程式語言的文件，以判斷其編譯器是否數值類型上執行隱含的擴展轉換。Consult your programming language's documentation to determine whether its compiler performs implicit widening conversions on numeric types. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範泛型和非泛型版本的數個值和參考類型的方法。The following code example demonstrates generic and nongeneric versions of the method for several value and reference types. Compiler overload resolution may account for an apparent difference in the behavior of the two method overloads. If an implicit conversion between the argument and a is defined and the argument is not typed as an , compilers perform an implicit conversion and call the method. Otherwise, they call the method, which always returns if its argument is not a value. The following example illustrates the difference in behavior between the two method overloads. In the case of the , , and values, the first comparison returns because the compiler automatically performs a widening conversion and calls the method, whereas the second comparison returns because the compiler calls the method. [!code-csharp[System.UInt64.Equals#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.uint64.equals/cs/equalsoverl.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.UInt64.Equals#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.uint64.equals/vb/equalsoverl.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks `s`參數應該是下列格式之數字的字串表示。The `s` parameter should be the string representation of a number in the following form. [*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性的符號。An optional sign. 有效的符號字元由和目前文化特性的屬性。Valid sign characters are determined by the and properties of the current culture. 不過，使用負號，只使用零，否則，方法會擲回。However, the negative sign symbol can be used only with zero; otherwise, the method throws an .| |*digits**digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9. 會忽略任何前置零。Any leading zeros are ignored.| > [!NOTE] > 所指定的字串`s`參數會使用解譯樣式。The string specified by the `s` parameter is interpreted by using the style. 它不能包含任何群組分隔符號或小數分隔符號，而且不得有小數部分。It cannot contain any group separators or decimal separator, and it cannot have a decimal portion. `s`參數使用的格式設定資訊中會剖析初始化目前的系統文化特性的物件。The `s` parameter is parsed by using the formatting information in a object that is initialized for the current system culture. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱。For more information, see . 若要將字串剖析所使用之特定文化特性格式資訊，請使用方法。To parse a string by using the formatting information of a specific culture, use the method. ## Examples 下列範例會使用方法來剖析字串值的陣列。The following example uses the method to parse an array of string values. [!code-csharp[System.UInt64.Parse#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.uint64.parse/cs/parse1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.UInt64.Parse#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.uint64.parse/vb/parse1.vb#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks `style`參數定義中允許的樣式項目 （例如空格、 正或負號、 群組分隔符號或小數點符號）`s`剖析作業成功的參數。The `style` parameter defines the style elements (such as white space, the positive or negative sign symbol, the group separator symbol, or the decimal point symbol) that are allowed in the `s` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. `style` 必須是從位元旗標的組合列舉型別。`style` must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. `style`參數，會使這個方法多載有用時`s`包含在十六進位值的字串表示時數字系統 （十進位或十六進位） 由`s`已知只能在執行階段，或當您不允許空白字元或正負號符號中`s`。The `style` parameter makes this method overload useful when `s` contains the string representation of a hexadecimal value, when the number system (decimal or hexadecimal) represented by `s` is known only at run time, or when you want to disallow white space or a sign symbol in `s`. 值而定`style`、`s`參數可以包含下列項目：Depending on the value of `style`, the `s` parameter may include the following elements: [*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*digits*,]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*][*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*digits*,]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 如果`style`包含、`s`參數可能包含下列項目：If `style` includes , the `s` parameter may contain the following elements: [*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*][*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*] 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space. 空白字元可以出現在開頭`s`如果`style`包含旗標，而且可以出現在結尾`s`如果`style`包含旗標。White space can appear at the start of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*$*|特定文化特性的貨幣符號。A culture-specific currency symbol. 在字串中的位置由定義和目前文化特性的屬性。Its position in the string is defined by the and properties of the current culture. 目前文化特性的貨幣符號可以出現在`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The current culture's currency symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性的符號。An optional sign. 符號可以出現在開頭`s`如果`style`包含旗標，而且可以出現在結尾`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The sign can appear at the start of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag. 括號可用於`s`來表示負數的值，如果`style`包含旗標。Parentheses can be used in `s` to indicate a negative value if `style` includes the flag. 不過，使用負號，只使用零，否則，方法會擲回。However, the negative sign symbol can be used only with zero; otherwise, the method throws an .| |*digits**digits*

*fractional_digits**fractional_digits*

*exponential_digits**exponential_digits*|從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits from 0 through 9. 如*fractional_digits*，只為 0 的數字會有效。For *fractional_digits*, only the digit 0 is valid.| |*、**,*|特定文化特性的群組分隔符號。A culture-specific group separator symbol. 目前的文化特性群組分隔符號可出現在`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The current culture's group separator can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個多載方法通常用來將各種不同的方式來格式化的文字轉換值。This overload of the method is typically used to convert text that can be formatted in a variety of ways to a value. 例如，它可以用來將由使用者 HTML 文字方塊中輸入數值的文字轉換。For example, it can be used to convert the text entered by a user into an HTML text box to a numeric value. `s`參數包含數字的格式：The `s` parameter contains a number of the form: [ws][符號] 數字 [ws][ws][sign]digits[ws] 在方括號 （[和]） 是選擇性的項目。Items in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性的正號或負號如果`s`代表零的值。An optional positive sign, or a negative sign if `s` represents the value zero.| |*digits**digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| 使用解譯 s 參數樣式。The s parameter is interpreted using the style. 除了不帶正負號的整數值的十進位數字，只允許前置和尾端空白以及前置正負號是。In addition to the unsigned integer value's decimal digits, only leading and trailing spaces along with a leading sign is allowed. (如果存在，負號`s`必須代表的值為零或方法會擲回。)若要明確定義的樣式項目中可以存在的特定文化特性格式資訊以及`s`，使用方法。(If the negative sign is present, `s` must represent a value of zero, or the method throws an .) To explicitly define the style elements together with the culture-specific formatting information that can be present in `s`, use the method. `provider`參數是實作其方法會傳回物件，提供特定文化特性格式資訊`s`。The `provider` parameter is an implementation whose method returns a object that provides culture-specific information about the format of `s`. 若要使用的三種方式`provider`參數來提供自訂的格式設定資訊給剖析作業：There are three ways to use the `provider` parameter to supply custom formatting information to the parse operation: - 您可以傳遞的實際提供格式設定資訊的物件。You can pass the actual object that provides formatting information. (它的實作只會傳回本身。)(Its implementation of simply returns itself.) - 您可以傳遞物件，指定其格式設定為要使用的文化特性。You can pass a object that specifies the culture whose formatting is to be used. 其屬性提供格式設定資訊。Its property provides formatting information. - 您可以傳遞自訂實作。You can pass a custom implementation. 其方法必須具現化，並傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。Its method must instantiate and return the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`、會使用目前文化特性。If `provider` is `null`, the for the current culture is used. ## Examples 下列範例是按鈕 click 事件處理常式的 Web 表單。The following example is the button click event handler of a Web form. 它會使用所傳回的陣列屬性來判斷使用者的地區設定。It uses the array returned by the property to determine the user's locale. 它接著會執行個體化對應至該地區設定的物件。It then instantiates a object that corresponds to that locale. 所屬的物件物件隨後會傳遞至方法，將使用者轉換的輸入來值。The object that belongs to that object is then passed to the method to convert the user's input to a value. (此方法會擲回如果`s`包含負號，並代表非零的數字。)符號可以出現在開頭`s`如果`style`包含旗標，而且可以出現的結尾`s`如果`style`包含旗標。(The method throws an if `s` includes a negative sign and represents a non-zero number.) The sign can appear at the beginning of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag. 括號可用於`s`來表示負數的值，如果`style`包含旗標。Parentheses can be used in `s` to indicate a negative value if `style` includes the flag.| |*digits**digits*|從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits from 0 through 9.| |*.**.*|特定文化特性的小數點符號。A culture-specific decimal point symbol. 目前的文化特性小數點符號可以出現在`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The current culture's decimal point symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*fractional_digits**fractional_digits*|數字 0-9 的一個或多個如果`style`包含旗標，或是數字 0，如果不存在的一個或多個相符項目。One or more occurrences of the digit 0-9 if `style` includes the flag, or one or more occurrences of the digit 0 if it does not. 小數點後數字才會出現在`s`才`style`包含旗標。Fractional digits can appear in `s` only if `style` includes the flag.| |EE|"E"或者"E"字元，表示此值會表示指數 （科學記號） 表示法。The "e" or "E" character, which indicates that the value is represented in exponential (scientific) notation. `s`參數可代表指數標記法之數字，如果`style`包含旗標。The `s` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag.| |*exponential_digits**exponential_digits*|從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits from 0 through 9. `s`參數可代表指數標記法之數字，如果`style`包含旗標。The `s` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag.| |*hexdigits**hexdigits*|從 0 到 f 或 0 到 f 的十六進位數字的序列A sequence of hexadecimal digits from 0 through f, or 0 through F.| 十進位數字的字串 (對應於樣式) 一律會成功剖析。A string with decimal digits only (which corresponds to the style) always parses successfully. 在其餘的大部分成員控制可能存在，但不一定要在此輸入字串中出現的項目。Most of the remaining members control elements that may be present, but are not required to be present, in this input string. 下表指出如何個別成員會影響的項目可能會出現在`s`。The following (它的實作只會傳回本身。)(Its implementation of simply returns itself.) - 您可以傳遞物件，指定其格式設定為要使用的文化特性。You can pass a object that specifies the culture whose formatting is to be used. 其屬性提供格式設定資訊。Its property provides formatting information. - 您可以傳遞自訂實作。You can pass a custom implementation. 其方法必須具現化，並傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。Its method must instantiate and return the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`、物件會使用目前文化特性。If `provider` is `null`, the object for the current culture is used. ## Examples 下列範例會使用方法，將不同的數字的字串表示法轉換為 64 位元不帶正負號的整數值。The following example uses the method to convert various string representations of numbers to 64-bit unsigned integer values. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式預設值 （"G"或一般） 中的值使用的格式目前文化特性的物件。The method formats a value in the default ("G", or general) format by using the object of the current culture. 如果您想要指定不同的格式或文化特性，使用的其他多載方法，如下所示：If you want to specify a different format or culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|文化特性For culture|使用的多載Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| ## Examples 下列範例會顯示使用預設值方法。The following example displays a value by using the default method. 它也會顯示的字串表示使用某些標準格式規範產生的值。It also displays the string representations of the value that results from using some standard format specifiers. 使用 EN-US 文化特性的格式化慣例來顯示範例。The examples are displayed using the formatting conventions of the en-US culture. [!code-csharp[System.UInt64.ToString#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.uint64.tostring/cs/tostring1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.UInt64.ToString#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.uint64.tostring/vb/tostring1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式預設值 （"G"或一般） 中的值使用的格式指定文化特性的物件。The method formats a value in the default ("G", or general) format by using the object of a specified culture. 如果您想要指定不同的格式或目前的文化特性，使用的其他多載方法，如下所示：If you want to specify a different format or the current culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|文化特性For culture|使用的多載Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| `provider`參數是實作。The `provider` parameter is an implementation. 其方法會傳回物件，提供特定文化特性格式資訊。Its method returns a object that provides culture-specific formatting information. 不過，任何屬性的可用時使用一般的數值格式規範 ("G") 格式。However, none of the properties of the are used when formatting with the general numeric format specifier ("G"). ## Examples 下列範例使用數種格式提供者，包括個而異的文化特性來格式化 64 位元帶正負號的整數值。The following example formats a 64-bit signed integer value by using several format providers, including one for the invariant culture. 此範例的輸出說明所傳回的格式化的字串方法是相同的格式提供者。The output from the example illustrates that the formatted string returned by the method is the same regardless of the format provider. [!code-csharp[System.UInt64.ToString#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.uint64.tostring/cs/tostring2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.UInt64.ToString#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.uint64.tostring/vb/tostring2.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式中指定的格式，使用值物件，代表目前的文化特性的慣例。The method formats a value in a specified format by using a object that represents the conventions of the current culture. 如果您想要使用預設值 （"G"或一般） 格式或指定不同的文化特性，使用的其他多載方法，如下所示：If you want to use the default ("G", or general) format or specify a different culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|文化特性For culture|使用的多載Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| `format`參數可以是任何有效[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)，或任何組合[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。The `format` parameter can be any valid [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md), or any combination of [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). 如果`format`等於或`null`，目前的傳回值物件以一般格式規範格式化 ("G")。If `format` is equal to or is `null`, the return value of the current object is formatted with the general format specifier ("G"). 如果`format`是任何其他值，則方法會擲回。If `format` is any other value, the method throws a . .NET Framework 提供廣泛的格式化支援，下列格式的主題中的更詳細地說明：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 如需有關數值格式規範的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 如需.NET Framework 中的格式化支援的詳細資訊，請參閱[格式化型別](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about support for formatting in the .NET Framework, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). 傳回之字串的格式取決於目前的文化特性的物件。The format of the returned string is determined by the object for the current culture. 取決於`format`參數，此物件控制符號，例如群組分隔符號和小數點符號，輸出字串中的。Depending on the `format` parameter, this object controls symbols such as the group separator and the decimal point symbol in the output string. 若要提供目前的文化特性以外的文化特性格式資訊，請呼叫多載。To provide formatting information for cultures other than the current culture, call the overload. ## Examples 下列範例會使用每個標準格式字串和一些自訂格式字串，以顯示 64 位元不帶正負號的整數值。The following example displays a 64-bit unsigned integer value by using each standard format string and some custom format strings. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式中指定的格式，使用值指定文化特性的物件。The method formats a value in a specified format by using the object of a specified culture. 如果您想要使用預設格式或文化特性設定，請使用其他多載的方法，如下所示：If you want to use default format or culture settings, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|文化特性For culture|使用的多載Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| `format`參數可以是任何有效[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)，或任何組合[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。The `format` parameter can be any valid [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md), or any combination of [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). 如果`format`等於或`null`，目前的傳回值物件以一般格式規範格式化 ("G")。If `format` is equal to or is `null`, the return value of the current object is formatted with the general format specifier ("G"). 如果`format`是任何其他值，則方法會擲回。If `format` is any other value, the method throws a . .NET Framework 提供廣泛的格式化支援，下列格式的主題中的更詳細地說明：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 如需有關數值格式規範的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 如需格式的詳細資訊，請參閱[格式化型別](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about formatting, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). `provider`參數是實作。The `provider` parameter is an implementation. 其方法會傳回提供這個方法所傳回的字串格式的相關特定文化特性資訊的物件。Its method returns a object that provides culture-specific information about the format of the string returned by this method. 當叫用方法時，它會呼叫`provider`參數的方法並將其傳遞物件，代表型別。When the method is invoked, it calls the `provider` parameter's method and passes it a object that represents the type. 方法接著會傳回物件，提供資訊來格式化目前值，例如群組分隔符號或小數點符號。The method then returns the object that provides information for formatting the current value, such as the group separator symbol or the decimal point symbol. 若要使用的三種方式`provider`參數來提供格式設定資訊給方法：There are three ways to use the `provider` parameter to supply formatting information to the method: - 您可以傳遞代表的文化特性，提供格式設定資訊的物件。You can pass a object that represents the culture that supplies formatting information. 其方法會傳回提供該文化特性的數值格式設定資訊的物件。Its method returns the object that provides numeric formatting information for that culture. - 您可以傳遞的實際提供數值格式設定資訊的物件。You can pass the actual object that provides numeric formatting information. (它的實作只會傳回本身。)(Its implementation of just returns itself.) - 您可以將自訂物件實作。You can pass a custom object that implements . 其方法具現化，並傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。Its method instantiates and returns the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`，傳回之字串的格式根據目前文化特性的物件。If `provider` is `null`, the formatting of the returned string is based on the object of the current culture. ## Examples 下列範例顯示使用標準數值格式規範和特定數目的 32 位元不帶正負號的整數值物件。The following example displays a 32-bit unsigned integer value by using the standard numeric format specifiers and a number of specific objects. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法就像方法，但是它不會擲回例外狀況如果轉換失敗。The method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. 這個方法就不需要使用例外狀況處理來測試如果`s`無效，無法成功剖析。This method eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a if `s` is invalid and cannot be successfully parsed. `s`參數應該是以下列形式的十進位數字的字串表示：The `s` parameter should be the string representation of a decimal number in the following form: [*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性的符號。An optional sign. 有效的符號字元由和目前文化特性的屬性。Valid sign characters are determined by the and properties of the current culture.| |*digits**digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的十進位數字的序列。A sequence of decimal digits ranging from 0 to 9.| `s`參數會使用解譯樣式。The `s` parameter is interpreted by using the style. 除了十進位數字，只允許前置和後端空格，有前置正負號。In addition to the decimal digits, only leading and trailing spaces with a leading sign are allowed. 若要明確地定義使用的文化特性特有格式設定資訊中可以存在的樣式項目`s`，呼叫方法。To explicitly define the style elements with the culture-specific formatting information that can be present in `s`, call the method. > [!NOTE] > 所指定的字串`s`參數不能包含任何群組分隔符號或小數分隔符號，而且不得有小數部分。The string specified by the `s` parameter cannot contain any group separators or decimal separator, and it cannot have a fractional portion. `s`參數會剖析使用的格式設定資訊中物件初始化為目前的系統文化特性。The `s` parameter is parsed using the formatting information in a object initialized for the current system culture. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱。For more information, see . 這個多載會解譯中的所有位數`s`參數做為十進位數字。This overload interprets all digits in the `s` parameter as decimal digits. 若要剖析的十六進位數字的字串表示，呼叫改為多載。To parse the string representation of a hexadecimal number, call the overload instead. ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫針對字串陣列中每個項目執行一次的方法。The following example calls the method once for each element in a string array. （[和]） 是選擇性的項目。Items in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 或者，如果`style`參數包含、`s`參數可以包含下列項目：Or, if the `style` parameter includes , the `s` parameter may include the following elements: 貨幣符號可以出現在`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The currency symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性的符號。An optional sign. 符號可以出現在開頭`s`如果`style`包含旗標，而且可以出現在結尾`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The sign can appear at the start of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag. 括號可用於`s`來表示負數的值，如果`style`包含旗標。Parentheses can be used in `s` to indicate a negative value if `style` includes the flag. 不過，如果負號存在，`s`只能表示剖析作業成功的零值。However, if the negative sign is present, `s` can only represent the value zero for the parse operation to succeed.| decimal point symbol of the culture specified by `provider` can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*fractional_digits**fractional_digits*|數字 0 的一或多個項目。One or more occurrences of the digit
